This graph:

http://www.cgreen.dsl.pipex.com/tmp/TicTacToe_SimpleDominanceChain.png

shows progress so far using evaluation against a dominance chain. (BTW 
it's worth noting the sudden jump in fitness in the center of the graph, 
just after a pruning phase has started)

Fitness against a random player has actually fallen slightly today and 
with the graph plateuing out to some degree I think this demonstrates 
that this specific experiment isn't working that well, especially if we 
factor in that the graph shows fitness vs generations - and that the 
search speed has now dropped off considerably.

So more work required, but an interesting first stab at co-ev 
Tic-Tac-Toe with NEAT.

Colin
